table-wrap.anchoringText: The proposed configuration essentially converts the 1-3-1 configuration to 1-5-1, with 5 rows of producers between two adjacent rows of injectors, as shown in Figure 13.Figure 13 also illustrates a symmetry element pattern (shown by dotted red line) that is used for evaluation of this proposed configuration vis- a-vis conventional inverted 7-spot infill pattern for their production performance. Table 1 compares the number of additional wells for alternative infill configurations in a symmetry element pattern.
table-wrap.label: Table 1
table-wrap.caption: Comparison of the number of additional wells for alternative infilll configurations in a symmetry element pattern

formatted-caption.caption-text: Comparison of the number of additional wells for alternative infilll configurations in a symmetry element pattern

tr.td: Infill configuration of inverted 7-spot at 290 m spacing
Producers between first and second row at 290 m spacing
